top_comment.author: jason666king

comments.text:
+Kyle Brockschmidt
Money is not free speech. Money is currency which can be *exchanged* for 
goods and services. In politics, money is *exchanged* for exposure and 
influence.
Free speech is a citizen's right for their voice to be heard. You're 
entitled to it, and everyone has one equal voice. However, you're not 
entitled to money, and you don't have an equal amount to the next person.

If you can't get your commercial, or if people refuse to air it, they are 
not refusing you your rights to free speech. It hurts your exposure and 
influence, but your first amendment rights remain intact. The commercial is 
a product you bought for money. Do not confuse a product that has a message 
with your free speech.

The argument that money is not free speech gets us a long way in 
preventing/reducing political corruption. But hey, maybe you think that's a 
bad thing that gets us nowhere.
comments.author: Smaakjeks Kjeks

comments.text:
+nesia indo Money translates to speech. If I want to speak to the people of 
the U.S. I pay people to produce a commercial and then I pay for airtime. 

The money isn't speech is a bad argument that does not help us.
comments.author: Kyle Brockschmidt

comments.text:
+jason666king .
A building composed entirely of bricks is not a brick. This way of thinking 
is called the fallacy of composition. A corporation does not get personhood 
rights or citizen rights because a corporation is not a person or citizen. 
By the same token you can't charge a corporation with murder or sentence it 
to jail.

As for money in politics, the problem is unequal access to the public 
sphere. The one with most money will get their message heard often, and the 
one with less money will not. This takes form as ads on radio, tv, 
newspapers etc. If, for example, you want to run a radio ad for your 
campaign but someone else has bought up all the important air time on all 
the most popular stations, what can you do about it? Not much, in today's 
USA. You could say people should be smart enough to invest time in getting 
savvy with the politics and the facts, but most people don't have all that 
much time or energy to do it. There's a big difference between ought and 
is. Leveling the field among competing parties will at least allow the less 
powerful to get their say in the public sphere. If all ideas are given 
equal time and critique, then the best ideas will eventually win out.
comments.author: Smaakjeks Kjeks

comments.text:
Dear American countrymen mentally masturbating to your action hero 
fantasies so keen to bring up Afghanistan, Vietnam, & how many hunting 
rifles you have, I am going to suggest something to you.

Perhaps you should look a little closer at the gross disparity in 
causalities suffered by the Viet Cong or the Taliban versus the causalities 
of the U.S. military. Because despite what you have seen in Norris & 
Stallone movies people die a lot in wars, & white people die in wars just 
like everyone else.

Additionally you might want to consider the possibility that Mexico & 
Canada i.e. America's geographic neighbors aren't likely to shelter 
American militants or provide arms & equipment to them. Which by the way 
was the case with both the Viet Cong & the Taliban.

Furthermore, you might want to remember that unlike Afghanistan & Vietnam 
where people were attempting to expel a foreign invader, your little 
insurrection will striking at people i.e. military, law enforcement, 
government workers, & elected officials; who have friends, lovers, & family 
members within your pool of potential revolutionaries. Also funny thing 
about soldiers, they tend to like fellow soldiers more than other people, & 
tend to dislike people that shoot at their fellow soldiers. People in the 
military are funny like that.

In other words, in a little place I like to call reality, civil wars are 
awful bloody affairs that involve massive death tolls to both combatants & 
civilians alike from both sides. They are not simplistic white hat versus 
black hat affairs where everyone joins your team because you think your 
right. Because most people will simply want to go about their lives without 
getting shot or blown up, by you or the government.

Continuing on, you might want to contemplate the idea that you so keen to 
be revolutionaries might not be on the same page, & could in fact end up 
with multiple factions vying for supremacy against each other & the current 
government.

& crushing as this is going to be for you to hear, I am sorry you probably 
aren't going to be the one leading your glorious revolution. In all 
likelihood you will be just another bullet sponge, that no one remembers or 
cares about, with the exception of your family who has to try & continue 
on, even though you are a corpse. That's another one of those funny things 
about war, poor dumb bastards nobody remembers, tend to outnumber the 
people they make action movies about years after the fact.

Now I realize you probably don't actually care about any of these facts, 
after all contemplating the idea that an actual war might have consequences 
more complicated than what happens in a Rambo movie, well that isn't nearly 
as stimulating as stroking your deer rifle & fantasizing about being a war 
hero.

But you see some of us who prefer to live in a little place I call reality, 
understand what you are really talking about, namely a whole lot people 
being killed regardless of where they stand or what they believe. Probably 
in the millions neighborhood, which will also be coupled with even more 
casualties due to the collapse of infrastructure as each faction attempts 
to weaken the other, by destroying the infrastructure used by other 
factions. & also the very real possibility that like so many other violent 
revolutions through out human history, you might just replace the current 
system with something worse.

You know the kind that people point to decades & centuries after the fact & 
remark upon the atrocities that characterized the transition. That whole 
regimes that come to power via violence, continuing to use violence to 
ensure the continuation of their power.

Doesn't really matter though does it? Not so long as you can stroke your 
deer rifle & be a hero. 

Come on everybody lets take up the international retard chant:

*U.S.A.!* *U.S.A.!* *U.S.A.!* *U.S.A.!* *U.S.A.!* *U.S.A.!*
